title: Barry Gibb refuses to say Jimmy Savile introduced him to his wife on Piers Morgan's Life Stories

ITV are being forced to edit around an embarrassing moment on Life Stories – when Barry Gibb refused to say Jimmy Savile introduced him to his wife at Top of The Pops. 
The Bee Gees singer, 70, was left red-faced after he was asked the story behind his relationship with former beauty queen Linda Gray. 
In scenes that have been cut from Friday's show, Barry was asked about how he met Linda Gray and said: “No, no because even the name would send a shudder through you.” 
He then added: “She was brought to London by...” before looking at his wife in the audience who shook her head and asked him to stop speaking. 
Unusually Piers Morgan did not push the point, but added: “Actually we are not going to go there. The context has changed.” Read More Bee Gees legend Barry Gibb admits he's scared of dying having lost brothers Maurice, Robin and Andy Barry and Linda Gibb (Photo: Getty) 
An ITV source confirmed to the Mirror the scene has been edited out and the show will focus on a “celebration of Barry’s life”. 
Savile appeared on The Bee Gees This Is Your Life in 1991. 
Host Michael Aspel was seen on screen saying: “You find harmony away from the recording studios. Barry Gibb at his wedding to Linda Gray (Photo: Getty) 
"All three of you find happiness. Second time round to Barry with Linda in September 1970 after being introduced by young Jimmy Savile himself.” 
Savile, who died in 2011, aged 84, before his sex crimes against hundreds of women and children were exposed, hosted Top of the Pops for 20 years from its inception in 1964. 
Gibb says it was love at first sight with his wife, although he does admit on Life Stories he has been unfaithful. 
Gibb divorced first wife Maureen in 1970 and he married Linda the same year. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
